movies.title: Orthodox
movies.plot: Benjamin, a boy bullied for his Jewish faith, takes up boxing as a means of self-defense, alienating himself from his religious community. As an adult caught between two worlds, his desperation to provide for his family becomes the catalyst for a devastating series of events that ensures he may never find the acceptance he has always craved.
movies.simplePlot: Benjamin, a boy bullied for his Jewish faith, takes up boxing as a means of self-defense, alienating himself from his religious community. As an adult caught between two worlds, his ...

biography.bio: Stephen Graham was born August 3, 1973, in the small town of Kirkby, Lancashire, to a pediatric nurse mother and a social worker father. His paternal grandfather was Jamaican, and one of his grandmothers was Swedish. After years of small parts, he finally got his big break in an unexpected way, playing the dim-witted Tommy in Guy Ritchie's film, Snatch (2000). Apparently, Graham didn't audition for the role as Tommy--one day, he accompanied a friend to the audition for Ritchie and was asked if he was next. When Graham replied "no," Ritchie told the then-unknown actor, "I like your face," and was asked if he could start work Monday. So much is to be said of this actor, who started his career with bit parts on ITV (he played Lee Sankey on Coronation Street (2006) in 1999 and was also cast in smaller films like Pit Fighter (2005). Graham also appeared in the critically acclaimed Gangs of New York (2002), directed by Martin Scorsese, and on television, playing Sgt. Myron 'Mike' Ranney in the HBO mini-series, "Band of Brothers." The actor, though still relatively unknown, is climbing the ladder to the top very quickly, with roles in some of the most groundbreaking film and television projects.
biography.name: Stephen Graham

biography.bio: Michael Smiley was born in 1963 in Belfast, Northern Ireland. He is an actor, known for Le parfum - Histoire d'un meurtrier (2006), The World's End (2013) and Kill List (2011). He is married to Miranda Sawyer. They have one child.
biography.name: Michael Smiley

biography.bio: Christopher Fairbank was born on October 4, 1953 in Hertfordshire, England as Christopher E. Fairbank. He is an actor, known for Guardians of the Galaxy (2014), The Fifth Element (1997) and Alien 3 (1992).
biography.name: Christopher Fairbank

biography.bio: Rebecca Callard was born on June 3, 1975 in Dewsbury, Yorkshire, England as Rebecca Jayne Atkinson. She is an actress, known for Il était une fois Jésus (2000), The Grand (1997) and Promise (2017). She has been married to Gideon Turner since July 24, 2001. They have two children.
biography.name: Rebecca Callard

biography.bio: Giacomo Massimiliano Mancini was born on May 17th,1995 in London, England to English and Italian parents. He is an actor, Best known for his first acting role as Gem in Channel 4s award winning Mini-series Top Boy (2011-13). He went on to star in Ripper Street (2013), Pan (2015) And Orthodox (2016).
biography.name: Giacomo Mancini

biography.bio: Conor MacNeill was born in 1988 in County Antrim, Northern Ireland. He is an actor and writer, known for The Siege of Jadotville (2016), The Fall (2013) and Love & Friendship (2016).
biography.name: Conor MacNeill

biography.bio: Umit Ulgen was born in Turkey. He is known for his work on Doctor Strange (2016), The Night Manager (2016) and Orthodox (2015).
biography.name: Umit Ulgen

biography.bio: Glenn was born in Portadown, County Armagh, Northern Ireland. He was bitten by the acting bug whilst living in Dublin and after several years learning his trade, took the plunge and upped sticks to London, to pursue bigger things. Since relocating to London in 2007, he has worked extensively in all aspects of the acting industry, from well known TV shows like Dr Who and Stan Lee's Lucky Man, to appearing on the West End Stage as part of the original cast of Roddy Doyle's The Commitments. He continues to work in increasingly diverse and interesting character roles right across the acting spectrum.
biography.name: Glenn Speers

biography.bio: Robert Goodman was born in Northampton in the UK but now lives in central London. In the early days of his career between acting roles Robert worked as a London tour guide, and as a magician in the world famous Hamleys toy store in London's Regent Street. In his spare time Robert writes and makes his own short films. He has also written and performed his own 'One Man show', about the 'spirit' of London: A kind of biography of a City. Working mostly in film, Robert, even now after more than 35 years in the industry, keeps up classes, continuing to add to his skills. Other interests include: London and country walking, Writing, psychogeography, the life and work of Dylan Thomas, the natural world and most things that life has to offer.
biography.name: Robert Goodman

biography.bio: Oliver Woollford is an actor, known for Jam Today (2011), Eve (2015) and Echo (2013).
biography.name: Oliver Woollford

biography.bio: Colin Coombs is known for his work on Edge of Tomorrow (2014), The Legend of Tarzan (2016) and RED 2 (2013).
biography.name: Colin Coombs

biography.bio: Sidney John Kean was born on October 1 1950 in London, UK. Sidney's career has spanned over four and a half decades and has included extensive work in the theatre, cinema, television and radio. Naturally, he is equally at home in all these different fields. He is especially gifted at picking up accents and dialects from around this country and the rest of the world and making them sound natural and native. It was in the Reps and National Tours that he learnt the art of "deliberately staying there, watching and listening to other performers". It is often said that the best Actors are the ones that listen... Sidney is a past master at this art. He has superb comic timing as well as magnetic stage presence. He is also a breeze to work with! Sidney has numerous credits to his CV, has been performing professionally all his life and has excelled at theatrical roles as diverse as Agatha Christie to Shakespeare, light-hearted comedy to dark tragedy, experimental performance art to pantomime, musical Theatre to farce, serious television and film drama to Children's Theatre. His work has led to him travelling extensively nationally and globally and has worked with perhaps some of the finest Actors and Directors of his generation including Rod Steiger and Sir Lawrence Olivier.
biography.name: Sidney Kean

biography.bio: Joshua Youngerman is an actor known for Enemies in Love, The One, and 50 Ways to Kill Your Lover. He has trained at Acting Studio Chicago, University of Missouri, and LAMDA (London Academy of Music and Dramatic Art). He has acted on stage professionally in England and the United States. His stage work in England includes a stint at the Theatre Royal, Bath with the new writing company 20:20 Vision (A Definition of Love, Bread, Stairway to Heaven), The Space (The Hottest Day), and the Tristan Bates Theatre in Soho (Bug). He graduated from drama school at Rose Bruford in London.
biography.name: Joshua Youngerman

biography.bio: Born in the North East, 1968, spent over 30 Years in the building trade and 2 Years working in Germany was spotted by CLM castings when taking a friend to be an SA on the movie "Interview with a hitman 2012" and told he had a "good face", since then has worked hard at becoming a jobbing actor, has done featured work, SA work, film work and some TV series, also runs local music nights and has been lucky enough to be involved with many student films (Northumbria and Sunderland Universities), working with the next generation of film makers and learning the craft of acting and behind the scenes of film making along the way. Has three grown up children and resides on Tyneside.
biography.name: Mark Burns

biography.bio: Susan Wiseman was born as Susan Spencer. She is an actress and producer, known for The Wrong Kind of Luck (2011), The Primacy of Consciousness (2014) and Padre Cask (2010).
biography.name: Susan Wiseman
